alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:55PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Scotts Bluff, western Banner, southwestern Sioux, southeastern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Veteran to near Meriden Rest Area. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. Landspout possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Torrington around 505 PM MDT. La Grange, Huntley, Hawk Springs Campground and Hawk Springs Recreation Area around 510 PM MDT. Lyman around 520 PM MDT. Morrill around 530 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Henry. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
